articles.author: Caroline Valetkevitch
articles.description: U.S. stocks ended higher on Wednesday on optimism that the Federal Reserve may be done raising interest rates and that the economy is still resilient.
articles.title: Wall St ends up before holiday; investors optimistic Fed done raising rates

articles.author: Paul Carsten
articles.description: Oil prices tanked nearly 4% on Wednesday as OPEC+ producers delayed a meeting on output planned for Sunday, raising questions about the future course of crude production cuts.
articles.title: Oil tumbles nearly 4% as OPEC+ meeting delayed

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: More than 400 Macy's (M.N) workers in Washington state are planning a three-day strike from Black Friday through Sunday, alleging unfair labor practices and demanding better wages, according to UFCW Local 3000's website.
articles.title: Macy's workers in Washington state to strike for three days from Black Friday

articles.author: Arriana McLymore
articles.description: Upstart online retailers Temu.com and Shein are drawing millions of window-shoppers to their websites this holiday season, but they far lag market leader Amazon.com where it counts - turning those visits into actual sales.
articles.title: Temu, Shein far lag Amazon as online holiday shopping ramps up

articles.author: Lewis Krauskopf
articles.description: A look at the day ahead in Asian markets from Lewis Krauskopf, markets correspondent.
articles.title: Morning Bid: Markets in a holiday mood

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. prosecutors pressed a federal judge on Wednesday to require Binance Holdings founder and former chief Changpeng Zhao to remain in the continental United States before his sentencing hearing on Feb. 23, 2024, according to a court filing.
articles.title: US prosecutors want Binance's Zhao to remain in US until sentencing -filing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain needs a "digital alternative" to relying on Visa and Mastercard for card payments regardless of steps being taken by regulators, a report commissioned by the government said on Wednesday.
articles.title: UK payments report calls for alternatives to Mastercard and Visa

articles.author: Anna Tong, Jeffrey Dastin, Krystal Hu
articles.description: Ahead of OpenAI CEO Sam Altman’s four days in exile, several staff researchers sent the board of directors a letter warning of a powerful artificial intelligence discovery that they said could threaten humanity, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Sam Altman's ouster at OpenAI was precipitated by letter to board about AI breakthrough -sources

articles.author: Bassam Masoud, Emily Rose
articles.description: The release of hostages under a temporary truce between Israel and Palestinian Hamas militants will not happen before Friday, Israel's national security adviser said, thwarting hopes of relatives that some would be freed on Thursday.
articles.title: No Gaza hostage release will start before Friday, says Israel

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: Cuba Gooding Jr was sued on Wednesday by two women whose sexual assault cases against the Oscar-winning actor underlay a criminal prosecution that ended with him pleading guilty but serving no jail time.
articles.title: Cuba Gooding Jr faces new sexual assault lawsuits
